ptychodactyl.recon¶

Classes for ptychographic image reconstruction.

Currently implemented:

  • 2D ePIE (https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ultramic.2009.05.012)

  • 2D rPIE (https://doi.org/10.1364/OPTICA.4.000736)

Planned:

  • 3D CPT (https://doi.org/10.1364/OL.42.003169)

recon.Reconstruction(filename, **specs)¶

Load a PTY file and construct the appropriate Recon subclass.

Parameters

  • filename (str) – name of the datafile

  • specs – keyword arguments to pass to LoadData

Returns

Recon2D or Recon3D instance

Return type

Recon

class recon.Recon(data: ptycho_data.LoadData)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

abstract __init__(data: ptycho_data.LoadData)¶

Abstract parent class for ptychographic reconstructions.

Parameters

data (LoadData) – Data set that will be reconstructed

save()¶

Save the reconstruction to the original PTY file

class recon.Recon2D(data)¶

Bases: recon.Recon

__init__(data)¶

Create a 2D ptychographic reconstructor

Parameters

data (LoadData) – Data set that will be reconstructed

run(run_specs, animate=False)¶

Perform a reconstruction using the provided parameters.

Parameters

  • run_specs (dict) – parameters for this reconstruction

  • animate (bool) – if True, saves a frame after each iteration and animates them all at the end. Default is False.

show_probe_positions()¶

Show a scatter plot of all of the probe positions in the scan.

show_object_and_probe()¶

Show the object and probe in their current state of reconstruction.

class recon.Recon3D(data)¶

Bases: recon.Recon

Note

Not yet implemented.

Abstract parent class for ptychographic reconstructions.

Parameters

data (LoadData) – Data set that will be reconstructed

run(num_iterations, algorithm, animate=False)¶
show_object_and_probe()¶
recon.center(image)¶

Shift an image so that the center of brightness is in the center of the image. This is intended for use with a probe array to help keep the reconstruction centered in the frame

Parameters

image (np.ndarray) – Any 2D image

Returns

Centered image

Return type

np.ndarray

recon.init_object(shape)¶

Initialize an object to have everywhere a small nonzero amplitude and a random phase.

Parameters

shape ((int, int)) – Shape of the object array

Returns

Initialized object array

Return type

np.ndarray

recon.init_probe(data, sigma=10)¶

Initialize a probe for a set of diffraction patterns. The probe is generated by taking the average of all diffraction patterns, inverse Fourier transforming it, and passing the resulting amplitude through a gaussian filter.

Parameters

  • data (np.ndarray) – Set of all diffraction patterns

  • sigma (float) – Width of gaussian filter in pixels

Returns

Initialized probe array

Return type

np.ndarray

recon.init_probe_flat(shape)¶

Initialize a generic probe using a top-hat function and random phase

Parameters

shape ((int, int)) – Shape of the probe array

Returns

Generic probe array

Return type

np.ndarray

recon.setup_figure(actually_do_it=True)¶

Create a figure and 4 axes for plotting. This is really just a shortcut for the Recon subclasses

Parameters

actually_do_it (bool) – If False, returns all Nones. Default is True.
